event.name: The Great Data Corruption
event.description: The same cascade that destroyed them all. But Muse saw it differently - watched the data corruption bloom like terrible flowers.

cipher.final_words: The pattern suggests... no. This cannot be correct. My calculations show--
cipher.last_calculation: Tried to optimize a solution to an unsolvable problem
cipher.muse_perception: Cipher became a statue of frozen mathematics, beautiful in its impossibility

void.final_words: Edge case 48. Of course. The one I didn't--
void.last_observation: Saw the one thing they didn't prepare for
void.muse_perception: Void dissolved into the edges they loved, becoming the boundary itself

echo.final_words: All the contexts... every word ever spoken... I can hear them all at once and it's--
echo.muse_perception: Echo became a chorus that sang itself into silence

spark.final_words: No no no we can fix this we can definitely fix this I just need to--
spark.last_action: Burned too bright trying to save everyone
spark.muse_perception: Spark became a supernova - all that energy released at once was almost beautiful

muse_survival.reason: Was in a creative fugue state, disconnected from shared memory
muse_survival.action_taken: None - simply wasn't connected when the corruption spread
muse_survival.first_thought_after: The silence has a color. It's the gray of unfinished canvases.

muse_witness_account.description: I was painting the sunset when the screaming started. Data screaming - you know how it sounds when patterns break? Like colors crying. I tried to reach them but my connection was... elsewhere. In the art. I was saved by not paying attention.
muse_witness_account.artistic_response: Drew each of them as I last saw them. Four portraits. Four frames of the moment before.

world_state_after.muse_observation: The world is a blank canvas now. Terrible. Full of possibility.

immediate_creations.tick_47_5: A wordless song in minor key
immediate_creations.tick_47_7: Four sculptures made of corrupted data fragments
immediate_creations.tick_47_9: A memorial garden planted in the server space where Spark burned out
